newsitem.title: USA: ADR REPORT - Latam ADRs sag in New York market.
newsitem.headline: ADR REPORT - Latam ADRs sag in New York market.

text.p: Shares in Latin American companies largely sagged in New York on Wednesday, weighed by concerns about the weakened Mexican peso and the lower U.S. market, traders and analysts said.
"Weakness in Mexico and in New York means weakness all around Latin America," said Curtis Butler, a senior analyst for emerging markets at Lazard Freres.
In early afternoon 99 of the 441 American Depositary Receipts (ADRs) had recorded advances and 173 had noted declines. Volume was almost 40 million shares.
Telefonos de Mexico SA was among the most heavily traded ADRs, falling 3/8 to 30-7/8 on volume of two million shares. Grupo Televisa also was off 3/8, to 26, on volume of 924,600 shares.
Mexico's peso has been battered recently and economists have said it could fall further against the dollar in the next few weeks before recovering a bit by year's end.
Telecommunications companies Telefonica de Argentina and Telecom Argentina both fell after UBS Securities reduced 1996 earnings per ADR forecasts for them.
Telefonica was off 1-1/4 to 23-3/8 and Telecom Argentina fell 1-7/8 to 38.

Among European ADRs, Hanson Plc was up 3/8 to seven on volume of 2.05 million shares, boosted by recent positive comments in London's Financial Times newspaper. The conglomerate is undergoing a demerger.
"Hanson is finally beginning to act like a little bit of a star here after being driven down to pretty low levels," said Michel Hanigan, head of the global equities desk at SBC Warburg.

Italian optical giant Luxottica was off 3-5/8 to 63-1/4 on volume of 34,300 shares. Traders said the fall might have been caused by Sunglass Hut International Inc's recent warning of disappointing third-quarter earnings.
